Description: Five joining neck, shoulder, and body sherds of Attic black-figured pottery olpe with handle root; exterior: glazed black with shoulder area reserved (brown framing lines above and at right); black-figure decoration consisting of head, neck, part of wing of cock, to right (added red on eye, comb, wattle, body, wing feather); black dot rosette and black oval drops, possibly leaves, as filling ornament; inscription on exterior.
Producer name: Attributed to the Manner of: The Gorgon Painter
Curator's comments: Beazley notes that the style of the olpe is unusual.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.2)
